isis.stitle: TSI 93-04-05 - Proper Burnish of Brake Friction Material

subjectgroup.subject: Proper Burnish of Brake Friction Material

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 3900FC model chassis with hydraulic brakes built before December, 1992.

To assist in new brake pad burnishing (break-in), subject model chassis brake pads were faced with a slurry. The slurry assures that sufficient heat is generated to provide proper burnish of the brake friction material. At low mileage, as the brakes seat-in and as the slurry wears away, a cracking or crazing of the slurry occurs. This cracking or crazing is in the slurry only and does not extend down into the brake friction material. Slurry is no longer required and is not present on units built after December, 1992.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Friction Material Cracked From Slurry

geninfo.para: The above described condition is pictured in Figure 1. Additionally, a step may be visible between the base material and the slurry at the edge of the pad. The amount of slurry remaining may be determined from the thickness of this step.
Low mileage brake pads should NOT be replaced for this cracking or crazing. The slurry and any associated crazing will disappear as the brake friction material seats-in.
